head.title: Lustrous, Supple Leather, Made to Last a Lifetime

hedline.hl1: Lustrous, Supple Leather, Made to Last a Lifetime

abstract.p: Personal Shopper column on sources and prices of leather furnishings and accessories; photos (M)

block.p: LEATHER furniture and home accessories can be as comfortable as a pair of old leather gloves. Yet leather is also durable. ''Leather has an old-rich look that only gets more beautiful with age,'' said Teddy Edelman, an owner of Edelman Leather in New Milford, Conn. The look is classic, and good leather properly cared for will last a lifetime. How do you care for leather properly? Clean it gingerly with very little saddle soap, Murphy's Oil Soap or a solution of water and mild soap powder like Ivory Snow, said Mary Ellen Pinkham, author of Mary Ellen's Complete Home Reference Book (Crown, 1994). Never, she said, use detergent or wax.
1. Leather-covered men's shoe trees (only in red) are $115 a pair, at Moss, 150 Greene Street (Houston Street).

2. Weekend Lounge Chair, from Italy, has a dark brown leather sling seat and a three-way adjustable back; $2,410, at Room, 182 Duane Street (Hudson Street) or (888) 420-7666 (toll-free). A handmade pigskin screen from Mexico is $1,350 at Quinto Sol, 937 Madison Avenue (74th Street). A lamp base of strips of multicolor leather with a leather shade is $500, and a polished-pigskin end table is $1,150. Both at Duane, 176 Duane Street (Hudson Street). Reversible leather and felt bowls (on table), called Plyfold, come flat and snap into shape. In many colors, sizes and shapes; from late October, $28 to $50, at the MoMA Design Store, 44 West 53rd Street, (800) 793-3167. A sisal rug with leather border, in custom sizes with colored leather trim, from $250 for 4 feet by 6 feet, at ABC Carpet & Home, 888 Broadway (19th Street).
3. Water-resistant leather wall tiles by York Street Studio come in many colors and sizes; $40 to $77 a square foot, at Ann Sacks, www.annsacks.com or (800) 278-8453.
4. A leather and wrought-iron, 24-inch-diameter bistro table ($249) and chair ($149) are from the Bombay Company, www.bombayco.com or (800) 829-7789.

5. La Femme, a chair with Lucite legs, is upholstered in Squiggle Prints, an embossed lambskin (above, behind chair), $4,800. The leather also comes in a pattern called Tatter (below); $31 a square foot, from J. Robert Scott (to the trade only), 979 Third Avenue (58th Street) or (877) 207-5130 (toll-free) for other cities.
6. Paris, a tufted-leather headboard in full or queen size is $899; king size is $999. From Pottery Barn, (800) 254-2551.
7. Square leather bowl (left), $352, at Ad Hoc Softwares, 136 Wooster Street (Prince Street). Italian bowl, $380, at Barneys New York, 660 Madison Avenue (61st Street).
8. The child-size leather PBK Manhattan club chair is $699 in the Pottery Barn Kids catalog, (800) 430-7373.
9. Printed suede inspired by handmade African textiles is $20 a square foot, at Edelman Leather, 979 Third Avenue (to the trade only); (800) 886-8339 for other cities.
